availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard James Jameson (Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Margaret Givens on November 4, 1847, in Harrison County. Father of Mary Jameson, James Jameson, Elizabeth Jameson, Llwellyn Jameson, Samuel Jameson, and Magie Jameson. Farmer in Harrison County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 118A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 389.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Cynthiana, p. 19.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 6.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, X County Administration Bonds, 1830-1869; Vol 19-20, 1970-1975 (Accessed through ancestry.com on September 16, 2020), p. x of microfilm.
